image.alt: Smiling patients in a bright orthodontic office at Impressions Orthodontics

paragraphs.text: Impressions Orthodontics believes that everyone deserves a beautiful, healthy smile. We deliver technologically-advanced orthodontic care in a friendly, patient‑centred office, combining clinical excellence with flexible, value-driven treatment options to make each patient’s experience efficient and positive.

items.title: Flexibility & Value

image.alt: Smiling patient reviewing flexible payment options

items.text: Affordable payment plans, flexible scheduling, and treatment choices designed to fit your life and budget.

items.title: Fun & Seamless

image.alt: Friendly team creating a comfortable, streamlined patient experience

items.text: A welcoming team and streamlined digital workflows make visits comfortable, efficient, and stress-free.

items.title: Clinical Excellence

image.alt: Orthodontist reviewing treatment plan with patient

items.text: Dr. Nadia Nizam and the team focus on precise care and patient education to achieve predictable, high-quality results.

paragraphs.text: Dr. Nadia Nizam, BSc, DDS (Dalhousie University, 2003), Master of Clinical Dentistry in Orthodontics (University of Western Ontario, 2009), is an orthodontist in Calgary who creates confident smiles for patients of all ages. A former Captain in the Canadian Army, Dr. Nizam brings discipline and attention to detail to every case. She lectures widely, runs a local study club, and is recognized for her clinical standards and patient-first approach.

image.alt: Dr. Nadia Nizam, orthodontist at Impressions Orthodontics

paragraphs.text: From clear aligners to surgical orthodontics, we offer advanced options for patients of every age.

image.alt: Patient holding clear aligners for discreet orthodontic treatment
Smiling patient with modern braces
Custom retainers and retention solutions
Pre-surgical orthodontic planning for jaw correction

testimonials.author: Edwin Mendoza
testimonials.testimonial: My experience here has always been amazing from the beginning until now. Dr. Nizam and her team are very professional and knowledgeable. A big thank you to their financial coordinator Thao, she went above and beyond helping me with the Insurance claims.

testimonials.author: Akinola Akinsipe
testimonials.testimonial: Dr. Nadia Nizam is the best orthodontist I have ever come across and her team is absolutely amazing. They work very closely with you throughout the whole process. Very accessible, answering questions right away at any time and even respond to text messages! Highly recommend it!

testimonials.author: Kesa Murphy
testimonials.testimonial: I have appreciated Dr. Nizam's high standards - she wants your teeth to be perfect and isn't satisfied until that is achieved! I have completely trusted her expertise throughout the process of Invisalign. Appointments are always on time and her staff are incredibly friendly and helpful!

image.alt: Parents with kids relaxing in front of home
Enjoying time together

seo.page_keywords: orthodontics, Calgary, clear aligners, braces, retainers, orthodontist

og_meta.title: Home - Impressions Orthodontics
og_meta.description: Impressions Orthodontics in Calgary provides clear aligners, braces, retainers, and surgical orthodontics with personalized care and flexible scheduling.

image.alt: Impressions Orthodontics team welcoming patients in a bright office lobby

paragraphs.text: We believe that everyone deserves a beautiful and healthy smile. Our team treats patients exactly the way they would treat a member of their own family, respecting the time and financial commitment of orthodontic care and focusing on compassionate, high-quality outcomes.

Orthodontic treatment should be accessible, comfortable, and tailored to each person's needs and lifestyle. We build lasting relationships with patients and families while guiding them through every step of treatment.
We offer modern treatment options, including braces and clear aligner therapy, to create confident smiles with convenience and comfort.
Using digital tools, gentle techniques, and flexible scheduling, we make quality orthodontic care achievable for our Calgary community so each patient leaves feeling confident and cared for.

image.alt: Dr. Nadia Nizam smiling in clinic

paragraphs.text: Dr. Nadia Nizam, BSc, DDS, Master of Clinical Dentistry in Orthodontics, is an orthodontist serving Calgary, Alberta. She provides comprehensive orthodontic care for children, teens, and adults, including braces, clear aligner therapy, surgical orthodontics when required, and TMJ-related consultations.

Before specialising in orthodontics, Dr. Nizam served as a Captain in the Canadian Army. She leads a local study club to educate general dentists and their teams on orthodontic diagnosis and referrals, and she lectures as a key opinion leader for Ormco.

image.alt: Dr. Nadia Nizam in military uniform

paragraphs.text: Dr. Nizam earned her Doctor of Dental Surgery degree with Distinction from Dalhousie University, Halifax in 2003. She completed her Master of Clinical Dentistry in Orthodontics at the University of Western Ontario, London in 2009.
Her training and continued professional involvement ensure careful, evidence-informed treatment planning and close collaboration with referring dentists for complex cases.

image.alt: Dr. Nadia Nizam discussing a treatment plan

paragraphs.text: Outside of the office, Dr. Nizam enjoys running, hiking, cooking and baking. She dreams of attending Le Cordon Bleu, she loves to travel with her family, and she values teaching her children about diversity and resilience.
Dr. Nizam says, "After 11 years of schooling, I knew I was passionate about giving people a new meaning to the word smile." She and her team aim to treat every patient like family.

image.alt: Dr. Nadia Nizam smiling outdoors

image.alt: Smiling patients in a bright orthodontic reception area

Get Started.title: What to expect at your first visit

paragraphs.text: Your first visit is a full consultation where we get to know your smile goals. You’ll meet our team, receive a complete oral exam and any necessary X-rays, and review possible treatment options so you understand what comes next.

When you arrive we’ll collect or review your patient forms, any recent panoramic X‑ray, and your insurance card. Our treatment coordinator will take diagnostic records, then Dr. Nizam will review findings, answer your questions, and outline recommended treatment.

image.alt: Father with daughter at reception of dentist's surgery

paragraphs.text: We believe everyone deserves a healthy, confident smile and offer affordable payment plans starting at $150 per month. Final pricing depends on the amount of correction needed, the appliance chosen, the patient’s age, and treatment length.

If you have orthodontic insurance we will provide receipts as needed, but patients are responsible for filing claims. Dr. Nizam and our team will review all costs and payment options with you before treatment begins.

Complete your new patient forms before your visit to help us provide safe, personalized care. We offer online intake options and downloadable forms, and you can also submit photos through our virtual submission page when appropriate.

image.alt: Patient filling out orthodontic health history forms online
Enjoying time together

og_meta.title: Get Started | Impressions Orthodontics
og_meta.description: Schedule your free consultation at Impressions Orthodontics. Learn what to expect, complete new patient forms, and find payment and contact options.

image.alt: Orthodontic patient smiling, showcasing braces

paragraphs.text: Damon braces use self-ligating brackets to reduce friction and often shorten treatment time. They allow precise tooth movement while improving comfort, making them a dependable option for many orthodontic cases.

image.alt: Close-up of braces on teeth

paragraphs.text: Damon Clear brackets give older teens and adults a more discreet option while retaining the precision of self-ligating systems. They blend with tooth color for confidence during treatment.

image.alt: Adult patient smiling with discreet orthodontic treatment

paragraphs.text: Metal braces remain a reliable and cost-effective solution for many orthodontic problems. Made from high-grade stainless steel, they deliver strong, consistent results across a wide range of cases.

image.alt: Athlete wearing a mouthguard with braces visible

paragraphs.text: Invisalign is a system of clear, removable aligners that gradually straighten teeth without brackets and wires. The aligners are made from SmartTrack material for a snug, comfortable fit and predictable tooth movement.
Patients typically wear aligners 20 to 22 hours a day, removing them to eat and for oral hygiene. Your Invisalign Doctor will create a digital plan to map each tooth movement and guide your progress.

image.alt: Clear aligner set displayed on a hand

paragraphs.text: Spark aligners are made with TruGEN material that aims to stay clearer and resist stains compared with other aligner materials. They offer a comfortable, discreet option for patients who want an alternative to traditional braces.

image.alt: Woman smiling while wearing clear Spark aligners

paragraphs.text: Teen versions of clear aligners include compliance indicators so parents and the orthodontist can track wear time. Clear aligners give teens flexibility for sports, photos, and daily life while delivering predictable results.

image.alt: Teen smiling while wearing clear aligners

paragraphs.text: Surgical orthodontics, or orthognathic surgery, combines braces or aligners with corrective jaw surgery to treat severe jaw discrepancies that braces alone cannot fix. Treatments improve chewing, breathing, speech, and facial balance.
The process typically includes pre-surgical orthodontics to position the teeth, the surgical procedure by an oral and maxillofacial surgeon, and post-surgical fine tuning with braces or aligners.

image.alt: Consultation image for orthognathic surgery

paragraphs.text: After active treatment your orthodontist will prescribe a retainer to keep teeth in their new positions while the bone stabilizes. Relapse is possible if retainers are not worn as instructed, so ongoing retention is important for lasting results.
We offer removable and fixed retainer options and can provide Vivera retainers when appropriate, which are designed for strength and long-term wear.

image.alt: Custom orthodontic retainer shown on a model
Enjoying time together

image.alt: Patient smiling with orthodontic braces in our Emeryville office

paragraphs.text: Find answers to common questions about iTero scans, vPro, retainers, surgical orthodontics, mouthguards, and Invisalign at Impressions Orthodontics.

At Impressions Ortho, we use technology to help create the smile you want, this includes our digital impression system which replaces messy impressions. Using a digital scanner, we will take three-dimensional (3-D) digital images, or impressions, of your teeth and bite. These impressions are then used at a lab where they will custom-fabricate a model of your teeth. This model will help us create a customized treatment plan for you.

image.alt: Happy Family Portrait

paragraphs.text: The vPro is an at-home device that encourages teeth to move faster by delivering high-frequency vibrations. Dr. Nizam recommends using the vPro for at least five minutes per day to increase the chances of seeing the expected accelerated results. Ask us if vPro is right for you at your next appointment!

image.alt: Couple Enjoying Time Together

paragraphs.text: Surgical orthodontics or orthognathic surgery corrects jaw irregularities to improve the patient's ability to chew, speak, breathe and facial esthetics. In other words, surgical orthodontics straightens your jaw. Braces or clear aligners are typically used pre and post-surgery to allow the surgeon to optimize your facial esthetics.
Book a Complimentary Invisalign Consult: https://www.impressionsorthodontics.com/schedule-exam#form

image.alt: Collaborative Team Spirit Moment

paragraphs.text: Relapse refers to the movement of teeth back to their original positions after your braces/invisalign has been removed. Ideally, your teeth should remain stable after the retention period; however, there are many factors that are not in our control. Once your treatment is complete, Dr. Nizam will prescribe a retainer. A retainer is an appliance that is designed to keep your teeth in place long enough for the bone around them to harden.

image.alt: Smiling Man Working at Desk

paragraphs.text: Protecting your smile while playing sports is essential. Mouthguards help protect your teeth and gums from injury. If you participate in any contact sports, it is recommended by the American Association of Orthodontists that you wear a mouthguard. Choosing the right mouthguard is very important, ask us to recommend one for you at your next appointment!

image.alt: Mother and Daughter Smiling Together

accordion.header: What happens when I’m done with Invisalign treatment?

paragraphs.text: Will I need to wear a retainer after treatment to prevent my teeth from moving again? Most doctors recommend that anyone who has completed orthodontic treatment, whether with braces or Invisalign treatment, use a retainer to prevent teeth from gradually shifting back toward their initial position. Every case is different, so ask your doctor if you need retainers.

What type of retainer should I use? While there are many different types of retainers, we recommend Vivera® retainers. Vivera retainers are virtually invisible and made from a proprietary material 30% stronger than other leading clear retainer materials, which helps you keep your new smile. Your Vivera retainers will be custom-made from an impression or scan of your teeth using the same state-of-the-art technology used for Invisalign clear aligners.

How much do Vivera retainers cost? Contact your doctor for more information on Vivera retainers, as pricing can be based on your individual needs. All Vivera retainer orders will include an extra set, in case you lose one.
How do I order Vivera retainers? You can order Vivera retainers through your Invisalign doctor.

How long will I have to wear my Vivera retainers? Your doctor will give you specific instructions on how often you need to wear your retainers. Typically, you wear your first set full time, then based on your doctor’s recommendation you may gradually reduce how much you wear them until you only wear them at night.

Lose your Vivera retainer? No problem. If you lose or break your last set of Vivera retainers, or simply run out, just get in touch with your Invisalign doctor. Your doctor can work with you on purchasing a new set of Vivera retainers, so you can keep showing off that smile!
